content.question:
Charon complains.

Umbrarum hic locus est, somni noctisque soporae:
 corpora viva nefas StygiaStygius, -a, -um: Stygian, of the river Styx vectare carina.carina, -ae, f.: boat
 Nec vero AlcidenAlciden: acc. sing. of Alcides, -ae, m.: Hercules me sum laetatus euntem
 accepisse lacu, nec TheseaThesea: acc. sing. of Theseus, -eos, m.: Theseus Pirithoumque,
 disdis = deis quamquam geniti atque invicti viribus essent.

Aeneid 6. 390-394

Translate the passage above as literally as possible.
